name: Even or Odd Accessor 3 : Whatever Will It Be?
description:
Create a function that takes an integer as an argument and returns `"Even"` for even numbers or `"Odd"` for odd numbers. The function should also return `"Even"` or `"Odd"` when accessing a value at an integer index. Also this function should evaluate the same when instantiated as an object using the `new` keyword. Additionally, defining a `class` called evenOrOdd or an arrow function with the first parameter being called evenOrOdd containing only a number, should also return `"Even"` or `"Odd"`. Arrow functions can have any type of these braces as delimeters `()[]{}`;

For example:

```javascript
evenOrOdd(2); //'Even'
evenOrOdd[2]; //'Even'
new evenOrOdd(2); //'Even'
new evenOrOdd[2]; //'Even'
evenOrOdd=>(2) //'Even'
evenOrOdd=>[2] //'Even'
evenOrOdd=>{2} //'Even'
class evenOrOdd{2}; //'Even'

evenOrOdd(7); //'Odd'
evenOrOdd[7]; //'Odd'
new evenOrOdd(7); //'Odd'
new evenOrOdd[7]; //'Odd'
evenOrOdd=>(7); //'Odd'
evenOrOdd=>[7]; //'Odd'
evenOrOdd=>{7}; //'Odd'
class evenOrOdd{7}; //'Odd'

```

Note: For class objects we are only worrying about positive numbers since `class evenOrOdd{-7};` is syntactically invalid.
